DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Periorbital Edema Assessment Findings Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues)._Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye._Descriptive text used to enumerate additional non-coded pathologic observations._The words of something written.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Periorbital Edema Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues)._Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye.:Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.
